treatment.reference: Isolation and Characterization of New Strains of Methanogens from Cold Terrestrial Habitats Syst Appl Microbiol 26:312-318
treatment.description: Isolated from anoxic sediments of a pond polluted with paper-mill waste water of the Syktyvkar Forest Industry Complex. Had a characteristic sarcina-like cell arrangement and morphology. The cells of all these strains formed aggregates of varying size. The aggregates formed by cells were smaller with a diameter of 0.1–0.5 mm. Metabolized a wide variety of substrates including H2/CO2, methanol, monomethylamine, dimethylamine, trimethylamine, and acetate. Did not metabolize formate, 2-propanol/CO2, 2-butanol/CO2, methanethiol, or dimethyl sulfide. Non-motile. Temperature range 1-32˚C, with temperature optimum of 25˚C.
